title: shortDescription
content: A non-invasive medical imaging technique that uses high-frequency sound waves to detect and measure the flow of blood through vessels, allowing for the diagnosis of conditions such as blood clots, varicose veins, and vascular diseases.

title: Modality Name
content: Doppler Ultrasound (DUS), Color Doppler (CDU), Spectral Doppler (SDU), Power Doppler (PDU)

title: Imaging Principle
content: DUS: Uses the Doppler Effect to assess blood flow velocity and direction. CDU: Overlays color to represent flow direction and speed. SDU: Graphically displays flow velocity distribution over time. PDU: Shows amplitude of Doppler signal, useful for low-flow and small vessels.

title: Primary File Format(s)
content: DICOM (.dcm), AVI (.avi), MP4 (.mp4), JPEG (.jpg), PNG (.png), WAV (.wav), MOV (.mov), RAW (.raw), SR, TIFF (.tiff), VIV/VOL

title: Data Type
content: Multimodal: Image sequences, audio waveforms, color overlays, spectral plots

title: Conversion Solutions + Reference
content: Use pydicom + Pillow to embed JPEG pixel data.
Convert MP4 videos to DICOM using Filestar.
Use GroupDocs online tool to convert PNG to DICOM.
Embed WAV audio into DICOM waveform format.
Use Filestar for MOV to DICOM conversion.
Convert RAW to DICOM using DCMTK tools.
Use PixelMed tools for SR conversion.
MATLAB-based tool with GUI and code.

title: Voxel Size / Pixel Spacing
content: Influenced by beam width, focusing, and display settings; aligns with spatial resolution

title: Equipment Used
content: Ultrasound machines with Doppler-capable transducers (CW, PW, Color, Power Doppler modes)

title: Typical Manufacturers
content: Siemens Healthineers, GE Healthcare, Philips Healthcare, Canon Medical Systems

title: Primary Uses
content: Vascular assessment, Cardiac valve function, Fetal blood flow monitoring

title: Specialized Uses
content: Cerebral artery velocity measurements, Myocardial tissue velocity analysis

title: Safety Concerns
content: Tissue heating and cavitation risks at high intensities, mitigated by safety standards

title: Common Preprocessing Steps
content: Speckle reduction, contrast enhancement, motion correction

title: Compression Methods (if any)
content: Lossless and lossy compression (JPEG, JPEG 2000) supported in DICOM

title: Technical Challenges
content: Angle dependency, aliasing artifacts in high-velocity flows

title: Clinical Limitations
content: Limited penetration in deep tissues, strong operator dependency
